title: Annoying stuff
body:
do you ever leave during a game sometimes for a GOOD reason, then you still get a consequence and still have to wait for about 20M for the whole time before playing a game. Have you ever waited for a long time for this timer to go away and then you pressed confirm to play a game and then it says a problem occurred AND THEN you have to wait for another game again? if this pisses you off comment down below.


BTW lol (league of legends ) if your reading this I am  complaining about this.

replies.body: When you leave a game, no matter for what reason, you're ruining the experience for the other 9 players.

> [{quoted}](name=Canley Vale,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=XuMEcAXd,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-03-26T09:18:22.397+0000)
>
> When you leave a game, no matter for what reason, you're ruining the experience for the other 9 players.

Sometimes, those other players are ruining your experience, and you're just punishing yourself by staying.
Ever had a troll {{champion:223}}  on your team?
You know, the guy who eats you and takes you back into the fight after you just escaped with 10 hp. Or eats you and then ults into base laser, etc.

But then again, I've never had a leaver buster penalty, so I must do it infrequently enough that it is justified.
not justified, you probably just play norms all day and no one cares about reporting.

Even assuming that QAPLA hadn't been reported by anyone, Leavebuster is one system in league that isn't reliant on player reports to do it's job. It can actually detect when someone is inactive in-game for more than a few minutes, or when they disconnect from the game, so it stands to reason that if they were leaving often enough they *should* still trigger Leavebuster.

When it comes down to it, Riot isn't necessarily "against" players dodging, or even leaving, games where they have to deal with trolls, if such cases are infrequent, which would seem to be the case with QAPLA (not to say they necessarily condone the behaviour either, but they don't condemn it outright).

As a side note, this thread is two months old and should have been left alone. Posting in old threads is considered a "necro" and usually results in the thread being locked.
